lexUnit.name: hypothesis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a conjecture which explains a phenomenon and can be tested by experimentation

sentence.text: There are two ways to test the hypothesis that the effect of PMA on electrical properties of rat β-cells is independent of PKC activation .

The signal sequence is crucial for efficient translocation ; mutations in the signal sequence significantly reduce export of the preprotein and complete deletions of the signal sequence eliminate essentially all export [ 5 6 7 8 ] . Selection for extragenic suppressors of such export defective preproteins led to the identification of the prl alleles of secY ( prlA ) , secE ( prlG ) , secA ( prlD ) , and more recently secG ( prlH ) [ 6 9 10 11 ] . Early hypotheses predicted that the Prl suppressors function by expanded or altered interactions with signal sequences , facilitating recognition of mutant as well as wild type signal sequences [ 6 ] .

The traditional view is that arthropods are more closely related to annelids than to nematodes , but some recent molecular phylogenies place nematodes and arthropods together in a high-level taxon named Ecdysozoa , which does not include annelids [ 24 25 ] . Other molecular studies give conflicting results [ 26 27 ] . Regardless of the evolutionary relationship between Nematoda and Arthropoda , C . elegans and Drosophila remain useful and valid models for our analyses , and the relationships shown in Figure 1 are consistent with both hypotheses .
